title: How Joe Manchin Left a Global Tax Deal in Limbo
author: Alan Rappeport and Jim Tankersley
text: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen’s signature achievement is in jeopardy if the United States cannot ratify the tax agreement that she brokered.

title: Extreme Heat Puts Life on Hold in Britain, a Land Not Built for It
author: Mark Landler
text: In a country more accustomed to temperate weather, a brutal heat wave tested Britain’s infrastructure and forced millions to choose between a Stygian commute or a stifling home office.

title: Why Europe Is Becoming a Heat Wave Hot Spot
author: Henry Fountain
text: This year’s scorching weather is in keeping with a trend. Scientists say a number of factors, including changes in the jet stream, are in play.

title: Plans to Fight Global Warming Face an Obstacle in Paris: Trees
author: Constant Méheut
text: As a new heat wave bakes the French capital and the rest of Europe, critics say that plans to make the city greener have led to the felling of trees essential to combating rising temperatures.

title: Tracking Dangerous Heat in the U.S.
author: Matthew Bloch, Lazaro Gamio, Zach Levitt, Eleanor Lutz and John-Michael Murphy
text: See detailed maps of the latest heat index forecasts in the United States.

title: 4 Dead in Indiana Mall Shooting, Officials Say
author: Vimal Patel and Melina Delkic
text: The attack by a gunman unfolded at the Greenwood Park Mall in Greenwood, Ind., on Sunday before another armed man fatally shot the assailant, city officials said.

title: Covid Rises Across U.S. Amid Muted Warnings and Murky Data
author: Julie Bosman, Thomas Fuller and Edgar Sandoval
text: BA.5, a highly transmissible variant, is dominating a surge of new infections. Many health officials say the wave is cause for caution, not alarm.

title: Democrats Navigate Nuanced Views on Abortion Among Black Voters
author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
text: Faced with a streak of conservatism about abortion among some Black Americans, a vital constituency for President Biden, Democrats are framing the issue as part of a broader civil rights struggle.

title: What Pregnancy and Childbirth Do to the Bodies of Young Girls
author: Stephanie Nolen
text: An Ohio 10-year-old’s recent abortion has generated fierce debate. Doctors in countries where pregnancy is common in adolescents say the toll of childbirth on young bodies is brutal.

title: Adrift Between My Parents’ Two Americas
author: David Treuer
text: David Treuer’s father, an Austrian immigrant, loved this country. His Native mother, born on a reservation, could never forgive it. Where does that leave him?

title: Word of Trump Media Deal Is Said to Have Leaked Months in Advance
author: Matthew Goldstein
text: Federal authorities are investigating a surge in trading that preceded the announcement of a $300 million deal with the former president’s media company.

title: Claes Oldenburg Dies at 93; Pop Artist Made the Everyday Monumental
author: Martha Schwendener
text: Taking ordinary objects like hamburgers and household items, he sculpted them in unfamiliar, often imposing dimensions — what he called his “Colossal Monuments.”

title: Love the Smell of Old Books? This Bookseller Would Like You to Leave.
author: Dwight Garner
text: In his grouchy, funny memoir, “A Factotum in the Book Trade,” Marius Kociejowski writes about what a good bookstore should feel like, famous customers he’s served and more.

title: Putin Thinks He’s Winning
author: Tatiana Stanovaya
text: And his plans go far beyond Ukraine.

title: I Work for Midwestern Democrats, and I Know How to Win Back Voters From the G.O.P.
author: Brian Stryker
text: Stop letting Republicans own the issues of outsourcing and trade.

title: Dear Liberals: Come On Down!
author: Margaret Renkl
text: Railing on social media from your blue state won’t change a thing down here.

title: I Went to the State Where the First Big Fight Over Abortion Is On. Here’s What I Saw.
author: Michelle Cottle
text: Kansas stands as the first big post-Roe political test for abortion. It’s an intense, complicated fight, with the odds stacked against reproductive-rights supporters.

title: There’s a Better Way to Measure Economic Inequality
author: Peter Coy
text: Differences in wealth or income are not good gauges.

title: Don’t Drag Our Most Basic Rights Into the Culture Wars
author: Jay Caspian Kang
text: Democrats should reclaim the cause of civil liberties as Republicans move to restrict them.

title: Sometimes the Earth Makes the Rest of the Universe Look Very Good
author: Gail Collins and Bret Stephens
text: The photos emanating from the Webb telescope make it possible to forget politics for a minute.

title: Biden’s Fist Bump With the Saudi Prince
text: President Biden’s visit to Saudi Arabia; Merrick Garland and Donald Trump; the erased Secret Service texts; political changes; Columbia unranked.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
author: Remy Tumin
text: Here’s what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Summery Marinated Vegetables
author: Tejal Rao
text: Grilled and raw vegetables shine when they soak in deliciously seasoned oils and vinegars.

title: When Biden Met M.B.S.
author: Sabrina Tavernise, Rachelle Bonja, Eric Krupke, Sydney Harper, Anita Badejo, Lisa Chow, Michael Simon Johnson, Marion Lozano, Rowan Niemisto and Chris Wood
text: What did the encounter tell us about relations between the U.S. and Saudi Arabia?

title: What Will Post-Roe Medical Care Look Like? A Times Event.
author: The New York Times
text: The Opinion podcast host Lulu Garcia-Navarro explores the future of reproductive health care in a virtual event on July 21.

title: The Unraveling of an Award-Winning Documentary
author: Jane Arraf
text: The director of “Sabaya,” about Yazidi women who had been sexually enslaved by ISIS, says that he wasn’t present for a key scene and that he substituted footage.

title: For Monkeypox Patients, Excruciating Symptoms and a Struggle for Care
author: Sharon Otterman
text: As New York City and the federal government strain to supply enough vaccines, patients face a private battle to find treatment and relief from serious symptoms.

title: The Secret to an Elephant’s Trunk Is Skin Deep
author: Richard Sima
text: The folds on an elephant’s facial appendage aren’t just for show.

title: Georgia Congressman Subpoenaed in Trump Inquiry
author: Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim
text: Representative Jody Hice has been one of the most vocal proponents of false claims that Donald J. Trump won the 2020 presidential election.

title: A Debilitating Illness, Often Ignored
author: Dani Blum
text: Nearly one in 10 women experience the chronic pain of endometriosis, but for many, the symptoms are dismissed. Why is this still happening?

title: How to Keep Pets Cool and Safe During a Heat Wave
author: Dani Blum
text: Extreme temperatures pose particular dangers to furry friends.

title: A Psychedelic Renaissance at the V.A.
author: Ernesto Londoño
text: Four Veterans Affairs clinicians, frustrated with existing treatments for addiction and PTSD, have turned to drugs the government still deems illegal.

title: Meditations for Uncertain Times
author: Tara Parker-Pope
text: We’ve created a week’s worth of five-minute meditations to ease your stress and calm your mind.

title: Largest Study to Date Shows How Covid Vaccines Affect Periods
author: Knvul Sheikh
text: For some, a side effect of getting vaccinated was a change in menstrual cycles — but experts say there is no cause for alarm.

title: On Gum Drop Grapes and Other Fruits Designed to Taste Like Candy
author: Alex Beggs
text: Advances in plant breeding and indoor growing have led to produce that promises to be perfectly sweet.
